intro: Erythraea alopecuroides, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. The wood of Erythraea alopecuroides is highly valued for its durability and rich reddish color, though it is also used in traditional medicine.
